Rl BY SRI.E.C.BINEESH, PP R2-R5 BY ADV. AJOY VENU THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 08.01.2020, ALONG WITH Crl.MC.5386/2019(C), Crl.MC.5391/2019(D), THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Cr1.M.C.Nos.5386, 5391 & 5413 of 2019 , 2020/KER/755 COMMON ORDER [ Crl.MC.5386/2019, Cr1.MC.5391/2019, Cr1.MC.5413/2019 ] Dated this the 8th day of January 2020 Crl.M.C.No.5413/2019 is filed by the 1 accused, Crl.M.C.No.5386/2019 is filed by the 2"* accused and Crl.M.C.No.5391/2019 is filed by the 3 accused in Crime No.290/2015 of Valayam Police Station. The case against the 1*%* accused is presently pending before the Additional Sessions Court-IV, Kozhikode as L.P.No.18/2019, the case against the 2 accused is pending before the same Court as .C.No.733/2018 and the case against the 3* accused is pending as S.C.No.480/2019 before the said Court. The cases against the accused were committed at different stages and that is why it was split up and three cases emanated from the same crime. The accused have allegedly committed the offences punishable under Sections 143, 147, 148, 341, 323, 324, 308 read with Section 149 of I.P.cC. The defacto complainant/injured are respondents 2 to 5 in all the three cases. They have appeared through a Crl1.M.C.Nos.5386, 5391 & 5413 of 2019 ; 2020/KER/755 Counsel and have filed affidavits stating that the matter has been amicably settled and they have no existing grievance whatsoever against the petitioners. A report has been filed by the investigating officer through the Senior Public Prosecutor to that effect. The petitioners do not have any criminal antecedents. Even though the offence under Section 308 of I.P.C. is incorporated, the injuries are not life-threatening. No public public interest is involved. In the result, the Crl.M.Cs. are allowed and the entire proceedings as against the petitioners in Crime No.290/2015 of Valayam Police Station, now pending as L.P.No.18/2019, S.C.Nos.733/2018 and 480/2019 before the Additional Sessions Court-IV, Kozhikode, shall stand quashed under Section 482 of Cr.P.C. and the petitioners are discharged.
